Mike Cheung's website
About me My research My teaching My research tools

My research tools

Open-source software (free as in free speech and in free beer) that I find useful in my work

  • Operating system: Linux (Linux Mint and Fedora)
  • Unix-like environment in Windows: Cygwin
  • Statistical environment: R
    • Structural equation modeling: OpenMx, and lavaan
    • Multilevel modeling: lme4
    • Meta-analysis: metafor and metaSEM
    • Reproducible research: R Markdown with Pandoc, LaTeX with Sweave
    • IDE: RStudio
  • Dynamic programming language: Julia
  • Bayesian modelling: JAGS and Stan
  • Generating diagrams in DOT language: Graphviz and dot2tex
  • Synchronizing files among computers: rsync and Syncthing
  • Remote control: TigerVNC
  • Version control system: Git and GitHub
  • Building files automatically: GNU make
  • Programming languages: C and Python
  • Preparing documents: LibreOffice with Zotero
  • Editors/IDE: Atom, Vim, Emacs, Jupyter Notebook, with ESS, and Org mode

Proprietary software that I occasionally use in my work

  • Statistical packages: SPSS, SAS, and Stata
  • Structural equation modeling: Mplus, Lisrel, and EQS
